speaker: Alley
lines: The alley is a throat the city clears quietly.
Rain remembers the route; it takes it again tonight just in case.
Crates lean like eavesdroppers deciding to be helpful.
A chalk X that moved earlier pretends to be where you expected.
A bottle rolls uphill two inches, then remembers itself and stops.
Someone coughs without wanting to; someone else stops breathing on purpose.
A hand extends from shadow palm-up as if it has nothing to hide.
A second hand extends, knife-down, as if to agree.

choices.text: Meet the knife with your own.
Back away and find the bookcase door.
